The side $BC$ of the triangle $ABC$ touches the incircle $(I)$ in $X$ and the excircle $(J)$ relative to $BC$ in $Y$. Let $U$ be the midpoint of $B$ and $C$. Show that if the lines $UI$ meets the altitude $AD$ of $ABC$ in $P$, then $AP$ is equal to the inradius of $ABC$. State and prove a similar proposition for the excircles.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
